name: Sheraton Sand Key Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for one night after returning from a cruise. The location was nice, although it was a little far removed from the shops/restaurants of Clearwater Beach. You needed to drive to most locations. There was a huge beach outside of the hotel, and some restaurants within the hotel, which were decent. The beds were SO comfortable. Everything was clean, and service was fine!
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable beds!

reviews.text: We actually stayed here March 2010. The hotel rooms were adequate, the pool area was nice for kids, restaurant is very good. In fact it was my daughters birthday while we stayed here, and the chefs made her a birthday cake to celebrate, which I thought was a very personal touch for a chain hotel. The restaurant staff were really excellent. We did find te reception staff a little abrupt and cold, but the concierge staff made up for it 100 fold. Being from the UK, we were unfortunate on our last day to find that we were stuck in the US due to the Volcano in Iceland. The concierge phoned around and found us a room in another Sheraton hotel in Orlando. We were in a worrying situation, and the concierge were both helpful and sympathetic. Full marks ! I would stay at this hotel again, but they need to debug the bar area more often, my partner got savaged by sand flies (occupational hazard) in the bar on two occasions. In summary - rooms pretty good, view great (sea view), location great, restaurant great, most staff great, could do better on reception. For anyone interested in wildlife, there are some great sea trips nearby, and we saw dolphins near the beach playing in the mornings (which I hope survived BP) !
reviews.title: Sea View rooms are great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was a bit skeptical about booking the Sheraton. Especially going during Spring Break. While it is true that the walls are thin and that you hear everyone walking/talking in the corridor, since it is away from the Clearwater Beach, you dont get the party crowd the other hotels might get. We could hear music/bass coming from what must have been the Shepards on the other side of the bridge, but it wasnt loud enough to bother us. The bed was very comfy, the room service was excellent. Yes there is a large gap under the door, but as my wife said, it acts as a night light. We didnt care about the sink being outside the bathroom, nor its size. We've seen worse.
reviews.title: Not much needed to get a 5/5

reviews.text: The beach is amazing. We did rent a cabana with 2 chairs for 25$ for the day. We left for 90 minutes at lunch hour and our stuff was still there when we got back. The beach isnt crowdy at all. It is full of small shells though, so you might want to bring water shoes/sandals. Also, the day we were at the beach, there was a lot of jellyfish. I cant say if its always like that, but it certainly kept us out of the water. There is a bar service on the beach which is very appreciated. The only thing missing is a bathroom near the beach because it is a long walk to go back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: We ate breakfast at Rusty's every morning and tried it at dinner once. Food was excellent all times. One night, we ate at the Tavern and watched a hockey game on the TVs and once again we received great service.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay
Best in Area
reviews.text: Just returned from Sheraton Sand Key and we were very pleased. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly and go above and beyond to make your stay pleasant. The rooms are clean and attractive, the suites are much larger and have a long balcony. The food is very nice, especially Rusty's. It is on a lovely stretch of beach and in fact it is so wide that it's a long walk from the pool to the shore. Cabanas on the beach for rent or lounges at the pool. It is much nicer than any of the other hotels in the Clearwater Beach area.

reviews.title: Great Place!
reviews.text: On our recent visit to Florida we decided to take in one of the coasts and get married there. Boy, were we happy we chose to stay at the Sheraton in Clearwater! The place is great and we are hoping to go back again next year.

reviews.title: Great place to be in bad weather
reviews.text: The private beach is really nice but if you want it to be a bit more lively take the 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive to Clearwater beach and chill out there. If you like a really quiet beach, this is the place for you - especially out of season (when we went). The whole pool area is cleaned every day (at about 6am before anybody would dream of using the pool, unless you’re mad). The restaurants, bars and little shops are excellent and the staff in them are typically friendly (if only us Brits were as constantly happy as the Floridians)

reviews.title: A relaxing family retreat!
reviews.text: Our lovely gulf-view room was always kept immaculate and you felt you were staying in a first-class hotel every second of the day.

Basically this is a great hotel, really clean, and of really high quality, with very pleasant staff, well worth the money, so if you want to visit Clearwater I would definitely recommend this place to you.
reviews.title: wedding and honeymoon

reviews.text: Just finished a great week at the Sheraton Sand Key! Great service, friendly staff, from the doormen to the great hostess on the club floor, Nicki. Nicki not only served the great food and drinks, she also had a wealth of local information about sights, attractions and restaurants. The beach was wonderful too.Thanks Sheraton Sand Key!
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: We met our family for a day of quality time after not seeing them for several months. The pool snack bar was a perfect spot for lunch and the pool was very nice . The rooms were very clean and spacious. The front staff was so friendly and made us feel very welcome. We ate dinner in the hotel . They served a really nice buffet and there was live entertainment on that night. He played a keyboard and sang. What a lovely evening. This is a great place to enjoy the beach too.
reviews.title: Family reunion

reviews.text: I have stayed at this resort a few times and it really is the perfect place for a business/family trip, if that opportunity exists for you. I was there for business only this week, but there were still late spring breakers with kids and the pools and beach access are awesome. Conference facilities are amazing.
reviews.title: Great family / business combo!
If you're into shells...
reviews.text: When I go to Florida, even on business, I spend a lot of time walking along the beach looking for shells. And there are good shell beaches, and bad shell beaches. This is a great shell beach. The hotel itself is lovely and the staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Get a room with a balcony and enjoy the view and leave the door open at night. There is a strip of shops in short walking distance with a well-known restaurant and a great sandwich/breakfast place. The descriptions of the walk to the beach by some confused me before I went. Here's the deal. The hotel is beachfront but the beach is fairly wide at this point. When you step out of the hotel, you step on to sand and have to walk a short distance past the dunes. If you have small children who need to be carried, I could see how lugging a bunch of stuff back and forth might get tiresome but for older kids and adults, I mean the beach is right there. But back to the shells - there are tons, including some I had never found before. I actually took a day trip by boat to a place called Shell Key, but the beach in front of the Sheraton was much, much better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large, clean rooms, great pool, plenty of parking, lots of families. If you are a family, this is a good place to stay. If you are a couple or single, you may want to go somewhere else. Kids everywhere; sitting at the bar at the tiki bar, sitting at the bar in the bar restaurant, running up and down the hallways and the elevators. Apparently the parents subscribe to the "it takes a village" theory and you are expected to be part of that village taking care of their children. Hot tub is open until 11pm and there are children in it , even in their diapers, right up until closing. There is no adult only bar where you can escape. Even for families, there is quite a distance of land from the hotel out to the beach.
reviews.title: Got Kids, Stay Here
Awesome Staff, but needs some work
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort 10/9-10/12 2004. The staff at this hotel was AWESOME! Bill at the Poolside Cafe was great with the kids and always very helpful. We had an ocean view room-nice view, but the room needed work--the carpet by the bathroom was seperated from the threshold, which could cause some tripping. The room was clean and decent size though. We added a fridge at $5/day and the maintenance man was there right away with the fridge, but the fridge was falling apart--the door was so bent out of shape that there was a gaping hole at the top. The beds are awesome with lots of pillows, soft sheets, and very comfy. The pool is average size but pretty basic--and thankfully very clean. The gulf is a short walk across the sandy area--no big deal. There were tons of shells covering the beach. This room was listed at $270 per night and with my AAA card it was $230--still expensive considering you pay extra for beach chairs and fridge--at least the poolside cafe's prices were reasonable. Rusty's Restaurant was fairly reasonable too. This hotel is a drive from Pier 60 or anything downtown--and downtown it's all pay meters or pay hourly parking--kind of takes the charm out of things to be nickeled and dimed. Overall the staff is what makes this hotel above average, but some remodeling should be considered in the near future.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed at the Sheraton Sand Keys for 3 nights Oct 5-7. It was very nice. We enjoyed ourselves very much. We had a real nice room, the pool was nice. We had dinner every night at the hotel. Very good food. All the staff were very friendly. I was a little disappointed with the beach. I'm not sure if it was from all the hurricanes, but it was rocky and alot of seed weed. I was just expecting it to be sandier. All and all it was a very nice place to stay. And the walk to the beach was not that bad.

reviews.title: The real deal
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel October 1-October 10. I read all the reviews on this website about the hotel and I was so absolutely impressed with this hotel that I had to "throw my two cents in". I travel a lot and this is one of finest hotels I have stayed in. The hotel staff was great and very attentive to all our desires. A few points...Several reviewers have made comments the pool is too small and the beach too long of a walk. Absolutely untrue! The pool is beautiful, adequately sized, and was never overly crowded the 10 days I was there. If you want a bigger pool, try walking to the beach and swimming in the biggest pool in the world...the ocean. The beach is not "too far" to walk unless you are the laziest person in the world. It is several hundred yards to the beach and a very pleasant walk. If walking the length of two football fields upsets you, you have more problems than a vacation can deal with. We used every possible amenity in the hotel including all three restaurants, both stores, room service, the business center, and the poolside bar. All were exactly "as advertised" and very much to our liking. The hotel does not "nickel and dime" you to death as a few people have claimed. The hotel does not claim to be an all-inclusive resort and if you want something not included in your room price, you certainly must pay for it as you would at any other hotel. We enjoyed every minute of our stay at this hotel and after 10 days, we didn't want to leave. This hotel is definitely the No. 1 hotel in the Clearwater Beach area. Perfect location. The hotel is located on Sand Key which is just south of Clearwater Beach. You can drive over the bridge and play tourist for a while (with a few thousand of your closest friends:) and then escape back to the sanity of Sand Key in minutes. I did a lot of research for this trip and did a lot of things all over the area so send me a message if you want more info. It's all good:)

reviews.title: best hotel we have ever stayed at
reviews.text: The Sheraton Sand Key Resort is an ideal location, rooms are beautiful with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The staff were all excellent and most helpfull. The view of the gulf and the dolphins swimming from our room was idylic. Facilities were very good, pool etc and the food was excellent. Me, my partner and our eight year old had a great time there and did not want to leave. I cannot think of any bad points about the hotel and we will definately be returning next year.

reviews.title: Overpriced hotel not really a resort
reviews.text: My husband and I justed stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key for a week. I don't think they should call it a resort, just a overpriced hotel on the beach. They only have one pool and it is very small for the size of the hotel. I felt like I was "nickeled and dimed" to death. Everything was extra, $7 a day for the exercise room, local calls were $1 connection fee and they charged for lounge chairs on the beach. I never would have thought to ask if the exercise room is free!! The room and view which was partial and blocked on one side wasn't worth the $175 and $229 a night. The staff were pleasant and very friendly and the rooms clean. The size of the bathroom was a joke and I think Sheraton should be concerned about these matters. It was well below par for a Sheraton hotel.

At check in I asked if there were any available rooms with a view, as I am a SPG member and was told there was not. I was also told that I would have to wait for my room as I arrived early. I understood this and was fine with waiting until 3. I checked later in the day and my room was ready. When I went to my room it was clean and fine for my stay. My room was right by the elevator (room 316) and as my family and I were trying to go to sleep around 8 the noise from the elevator area was overwhelming. It was fine during the day because I didn't focus on needing quiet, but at night it was bad. I went to speak with a CS representative and they offered a different room with a view, which was fine but it would have been nice if that was offered in the first place at check in. I was inconvenienced by having to repack and move as my only viable option. A meager and cheap offer was given to receive 1,000 SPG points and stay in the room. I paid much more than that for the room. I felt undervalued as a guest at your property and felt that with some forethought your CS group could have gotten it right the first time. I don't see room 316 being a good option for any guest that you value in the future, due to the noise from the elevators, guests, and the echo from the tiles floors.
reviews.title: Undervalued

reviews.text: Not many Clearwater hotels have as a wide stretch of beach as this one. It's a nice walk to get from the hotel lobby to the ocean beach front. One a clear day, you can really appreciate the beautifully clear aqua ocean against this beach. We even found some decent size sea shells along the stretch. There are 2 standing beach volley ball court. It's first come, first serve. They have sports equipment you can check out at the pool. The staff are very friendly. The check-in was effortless, despite of a large group of high school kids in the lobby. Due to Spring break, the hotel was extremely noisy. People were up and down even hollers, singing well pass midnight. There are several dining options in the hotel. We liked Mainstay Tavern, a restaurant/bar on the first floor. It has a nice selections of seafood and burgers/sandwiches at a reasonable price. It's a good option if you don't feel like to go out.
reviews.title: Lovely Beachfront Hotel

reviews.text: This place was a huge disappointment. For a category 4 Sheraton, they had to be very creative with their website to make it appear a lot nicer. The staff was not very friendly at check-in, and maintained an attitude throughout our stay. The rooms are ok, but you are a LONG way from the beach here. I mean, with young kids, it is a hike. Also, there were thunderstorms the first day, and the beach remained filthy for the rest of the week long stay. I'm talking stinky grass, and dead birds. They don't clean and/or groom the beach like many Beach front resorts. There is a pool, but it is not very big. The pool area was always extremely crowded...especially since the dirty beach was so far from the resort. I'd pass on this one. There are much nicer places across the bridge.
reviews.title: Won't be back

reviews.text: Wow what a very pleasent surprise. Booked stay through Airline as a flight & hotel combo. Could not have been better. We stayed 3/27-4/3 yes busy easter week but beautiful and wonderful staff...However a few REALLY STOOD OUT!! Many thanks to
reviews.title: Awesome stay!! will be back!
Great place to visit
reviews.text: JoAnn @Rusty's Clayton, Hugo and Jeremy also there.....And the Pool many thanks to Grant, Mario and Dave....YOu all did a wonderful job. We came to take my grandmothers ashes to final resting place and stay a few days on the Beach, It was WONDERFUL...everyone make it a MUST STAY!

reviews.title: Great Family Hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from a family vacation to Florida and spent a few days in Clearwater. The hotel was everything we were looking for (clean, quiet, close to the water). It was about a 3 minute walk to the beach but you could see the water from the pool. The pool is average size. Overall we really enjoyed the hotel and would book it again.

reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon in a perfect hotel
reviews.text: Before we left for our Honeymoon in Clearwater, I had read a few reviews on this hotel that said the beach and sea was a long way from the hotel. It didn't concern me as I enjoy a stroll. When we arrived at the hotel I was amazed at how lazy people must be. The beach is on the doorstep with a short walk to the sea! This is the most fantastic hotel I have ever stayed in. Everyone was polite, friendly, helpful and always smiling. The food in Rusty's was delicious and an excellent price. The rooms are clean and bright and the pillows ARE the best as mentioned in other reviews. I would be scared to stay anywhere else in Clearwater, as I don't think anywhere else could compare. PS Thank you for the Bubbly x

reviews.title: Wonderful staff and Pet Friendly
reviews.text: This hotel was wonderful. My husband and I were so excited it was pet friendly. Especially, since most PF hotels are 2 star hotels. I give the Sheraton 4 stars. The only reason I don't make it 5 is the rooms need to be renovated or updated for the price you pay. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. We will definitely stay here again. It is located in a beautiful spot away from the hussle and bussle of Clearwater Beach. Rusty's Restaurant is definitely worth checking out for breakfast. I recommend ordering the Sand Key Benedict. It was fabulous. Also, the room service is delivered under 30 minutes. You can't beat that.

reviews.title: Perfect beach, perfect hotel
reviews.text: Trust me, this beach is fabulous. While I was there in August the sea was transparent with absolutely no seaweed at all, nor were there any rocks, just tiny white shells. The sea was so clear you could see many different shoals of fish that would happily swim, not just by you, but into you, and as for the hotel, it is faultless.

reviews.title: Awesome beach. Romantic and Beautiful
reviews.text: The beach behind this hotel is awesome. The sand is snow white. In the evening you can go to the pier about a mile or so away where they sell crafts and have live entertainment. The pool is very pretty. This is one of the nicest Sheratons out there. The location is great --- take the road south to see where all the rich people live. Go north and you're in the fun area of Clearwater Beach. The little grocery store in the hotel is open quite late for snacks. I love Clearwater Beach.

I'll have to agree with previous post about the beds. I must admit the bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever experienced in a hotel chain. Pillows were not to my liking, I always try and bring my own pillow when I travel. The Mainstay Tavern was great. Wonderful place to hang out both before and after dinner for drinks. The staff was great. The weather cooperated and was able to enjoy the pool. Not all rooms have beach view, so be sure and request that if it's important to you. The food in Rusty's was good with a good atmosphere. Overall I would give the Sheraton a "thumbs up" and rate it the best hotel on both Sand Key and Clearwater Beach. I would recommend to anyone and will return for another visit without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Recommended. Great place. Excellent, attentive and friendly staff and service. Great balconies for view of beach. Family friendly.
reviews.title: Great Place !
Beachin!
reviews.text: Sand Key is across a small bridge from Clearwater Beach. This area is upscale from Clearwater Beach, quieter and with less traffic. One side of hotel is a municipal park the other is a large upscale condo complex. Across the street is the Marriott.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: Room was spotlessly clean and in excellent condition. All standard amenities.

Nice pool with separate wading pool for kids and a separate hot tub area. Nice snack bar in the pool area and a also a separate tiki bar by the pool. Plenty of beach lounges and towels and lots of area to be away from others if you like.
reviews.title: FRIENDLY STAFF AND QUIET LOCATION

reviews.text: A friend and I decided to take a long weekend to a kind of laid back more low-key warm place :) Clearwater was perfect. Pros for me were the very comfortable beds, delicious breakfest buffet, and. Some cons were the room views, not being on Clearwater beach, and the early time of the gym closing. My view was of the dirty rooftop :\ There wasn't anything to do on the private beach, so we liked to go Clearwater beach for the activities. The walk to the main beach is very nice (maybe 30 minutes or more), especially crossing the bridge (nice photo ops!) I wish there was a refrigerator in the room because we did have a rental car and ate out a lot, most times having leftovers. Our safe messed up several times so we had to call down too have them unlock it, which didn't make me feel very secure about my things being locked in there. We stayed a total of three nights, and for some reason they didn't turn down our room one of the nights. The people who worked in Rusty's were very nice and friendly. Overall, I think that it was a nice stay, but s little pricey considering the amenities.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here for three nights was pure bliss! Our room did overlook the parking lot, but we also had the intercoastal behind it. Besides, who spends time in the room? With an amazing pool area, and the gulf and beach just a few short steps away, we never wanted to come in. The rooms are very generously sized, and the amenities and cleanliness of the property assure that we will be back soon. The rooms were also blissfully quiet, one reason my husband and I normally would choose a b and b. The beds were, heavenly. Would never in a million years expect prices to be low in such a beautiful area. They were totally in line with what you receive. Stay off the beach, and on the Key in Clearwater!
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel!

reviews.text: First time to ever write a review and I did this mainly because of how disgusted I was by the view. At the check-in I was assigned room 315. Asked if it was a Water/Bay view and Linda mentioned it was a Parking lot view. I asked for something better and the only thing she was able to give me was 1st floor in front of a tennis court. First of all, who wants a 1st floor at a HOTEL? I mean if it was a Motel I would understand. But really????!!!! Plus, more noise/traffic on 1st floor than other floors. Secondly, how private is your suite when it is in front of a tennis court on the first floor? I was formerly at the Holiday Inn Express and my view faced the construction site. I purposely moved to come here to have a better view and closer to the water. So guess what? Room 315 doesn't face the parking lot. It faces a wall and A/C units (probably same room as vsquared13). Not even a parking lot lol! Called and again I got Linda. I kept asking for a better view and it seemed she didn’t understand that I didn't want the 1st floor. You would think she would get it after repeating, "I don't want 1st floor". Worst of all, 315 faces the elevator where again, you can hear conversation of everyone coming and going. I am so unpleased by this hotel. I doubt if I would ever return and certainly wouldn’t recommend it to my colleagues. I am here on a business trip.
reviews.title: Worst view ever

reviews.text: On a positive note there is a front desk staff name Natalina (or Natalia) who is very kind and helpful. I called to ask her to help me with my Wifi and she was very kind to direct me and take extra steps ensuring I was connected and satisfied with my stay so far. So, I asked her to see if she can possibly find me a better room with a better view! Now I am just waiting to see what happens.
reviews.title: A few gems in a disappointing "resort"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gems first: The gentleman who cares for the pool area is a real professional! He is constantly picking up, organizing, and cleaning the pool area. He seems to take real pride in his work. Within only a few minutes after a storm he had the pool are ship shape with the chairs in perfect line! The bartender, John I think?, was very helpful, polite and made a perfect Bloody Mary:-)
reviews.title: Too expensive for low level of service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for one night on a short beach trip. Liked the fact that there is no 'resort' fee for parking, but no wifi included. Really when Target, coffee shops and even grocery stores are offering free wifi it should now be a standard offering in hotels.
reviews.title: Nice overnight stay

reviews.text: Room was clean and did not feel cramped (we had a King Size bed). Very nice pool area with plenty of sun beds but there is a significant walk down to the shoreline.
reviews.title: Our fave place to stay in Clearwater!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were extremely courteous. Would stay again.
reviews.title: It's a long way to the Gulf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, I must say this resort has sentimental value. My husband and I took our first trip together and stayed here many years ago. The hotel staff is great, the rooms are beautiful, the lounge can get pretty lively on the weekend, the breakfast buffet is bountiful. Outside, the grounds are very nicely maintained, the pool, tiki bar, and poolside cafe can keep you out there all day. I have 2 disappointments though- the kiddie pool is the size of a large jacuzzi. Just a round pool. No frills. The walk from the pool to the beach isn't quick. Don't count on lugging toys and beach gear, pack light. They do have chairs and umbrellas for the pool and beach. The pool guys are very helpful with getting whatever you need. There is also a small sundry shop right inside from the pool if you decide you need a magazine or something that floats to occupy your 2 year old in the large non bubbly jacuzzi (kid pool)- they have a few toys for sale. Maybe they'll do a renovation in a few years to add a little fountain or something. All in all, we will continue to stay here as long as the budget allows.
reviews.title: Great pool service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An older hotel with adequate rooms, VERY small bathroom with a single sink (this in a two queen bed room). Pretty good gym which locals use (they pay).
reviews.title: Beautiful Location and Professional, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a trip to Clearwater Beach. Thank you to Jerry at the front desk for getting us a great room with a spectacular view of the Gulf! All the staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the staff at the restaurants. The last time that we visited was in November and it was much quieter. Will probably shoot for that time again next year.
reviews.title: Great experience - will go back again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great if you want to get away from the noise and crowds in Clearwater Beach. The rooms are clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Disappointed and will stay across the street next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Were given a dark corner room overlooking the tennis courts and beside loud vending area. Requested relocation both nights and were denied. Walking distance to great restaurants Backwater Grille and Maggie Mae's. Pool was very small and jam packed both days as the beach was too windy.
reviews.title: Awesome service, Too many kids, Chairs on beach 25$$$$$$ at a sheraton really.

reviews.text: Again everyone was so happy and helpful on the staff. Too small of a pool no repsect from many kids and parents. Sometimes service at pool sometime no..... thin walls. I was told there would be entertainment and there was not....... To pay 25 a day for a chair on the beach when we were paying 225.00 a night is sad, very disappointed.
reviews.title: I would not stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family over Spring break and payed 262$ a night for a room with 2 queen beds and a view of the parking lot. All I kept on thinking was, "I can't believe this room cost this much!" The bathroom is so tiny and space around sink so limited that we had to keep our toiletries in our suitcase. There is no fridge or microwave. The furniture on our balcony was rusty and the bathroom was not clean (I hate having to say that because I know maids work so hard!)
reviews.title: Away Just enough from Clearwater To Have 5 stars

reviews.text: The first impression sticks! We pulled up to sit in a line of cars waiting to be helped. The uninterested bell man was standing looking at us all. He finally asked if we needed help as I held the baby and my husband took out the luggage. We took our own luggage up to our room. At dinner, I asked for meatballs for the toddler. When the meatballs arrived with no sauce, I requested sauce. The waiter replied, "NO".
reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend staying here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the amount of money to stay here I thought service was not polite nor accomodating and the hotel lacked value. I do want to say the woman at the desk was nice.
reviews.title: Relaxing and away from the masses!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton Clearwater the beginning of April towards the end of spring break. Had a great stay! Paid for the upgrade to the beach front room and it was well worth it! SPG floor was fairly quiet. Walls are thin it's true but people were considerate. We were glad the sink was outside of the bathroom so one could get ready and the other could shower.
reviews.title: Great beach, friendly staff

reviews.text: Pool is on the smaller side for the number of guestrooms but we didn't go down there one day..... the gulf was calling our name! 1:00 p.m. we'd go down and rent 2 chairs and an umbrella for $15 (instead of the full day price of $25). The beach is lovely and lots of shells. I had seen info about sting rays and jelly fish but we didn't see either and swam in the ocean everyday we were at the beach.
reviews.title: Excellent family resort in a great location

reviews.text: The lunch cafe had decent prices and good food. Nothing too fancy but we ate there several times. One night we grabbed burgers and took them out to the beach to watch the sunset. Their turkey burger was wonderful! Went down only one morning for breakfast and ran into a little trouble with a server who didn't want to serve us and obviously wanted us to do the buffet. We mentioned it and then got ready to walk out - the manager followed us out and asked us to come back. Upon return she offered to comp breakfast which was very generous and not necessary! Management was very friendly - some of the hourly staff just ok! The gentleman in charge of passing out towels (middle aged) was wonderful, helpful and friendly! Asked if we just checked in did we have any questions.....
reviews.title: Lovely experience

reviews.text: Am spending the week in the Clearwater area visiting friends, thought I might need a day of peace and quiet poolside/beachside solo. Rather than staying in Clearwater I opted for a more understated/low key Sand Key. The beach is pretty but there is nothing to walk to or drive to unless you drive back over the bridge. I checked in early at 2 and headed to the pool. There wasn't a single lounge chair free. The shrieking, ball playing and water oozies...were out of control. The pool was TINY and there wasn't an empty spot in it. The towel guy also had free swim diapers-- I can only imagine what was IN the pool. The rinky dink walk up bar was a pathetic gazebo with a long line due to the fact that there was only 1 slow moving bartender. Couldn't read, got soaked (iphone wet too) by a pack of water gun toting monsters whose parents weren't particularly concerned with the vacation experience of others. Despite my desperate desire to relax-- the beach was kind of a hike and once I got down there there weren't any free chairs. Pathetic, but I came upstairs, showered and put on pjs. Quiet in here..but the "furnished balcony" has a flimsy lawn chair..I'm staring at a tennis court and a sliver of bay...somehow I cannot figure out where water front is? Maybe I could bring the chair down to the pool tomorrow??
reviews.title: Too bad I paid in full in advance! Want to run!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Sand Key and had a wonderful experience. The staff was very friendly, especially the pool attendants. Towels were provided (must show room key) for pool or beach use. There were also noodles for use in the pool. Chairs are first come first serve so get out there early. There are chairs with cushions ($8 each) and umbrella/cabana rentals available ($25 for the entire setup) on the beach, which is a short walk down from the pool. There is a food and beverage cart that comes out to the beach so you can have lunch and cocktails. The entire property is clean, they power wash the pool deck every morning. There was a place to get snacks, coffee, and donuts in the hotel, and the pool cafe is convenient. The Island Grille is a great place for lunch. This hotel is not located in the tourist-y area of Clearwater Beach, but a quick ride on the trolley can get you there in minutes. The bed was comfy and there is an HDTV in the room.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, friendly and helpful staff--highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a few negatives, one being the bathroom is a little cramped with the toilet and tub/shower in one small room and the sink outside did not have a lot of space for personal items. And we had a harbor view which was nice but at night it was ruined by the bright lights of the tennis courts. The pool was wonderful but could be bigger. Internet in the room was extra but there were 5 or 6 HP touchscreen computers in the business center which is located in the bar.
reviews.title: What a rip off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall--great vacation spot!
reviews.title: Very chillaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to get away for a night for our anniversary. I paid extra for a "bay view", expecting that I would be able to enjoy a quiet cup of coffee on the patio in the morning. I didn't realize (because the website mentions NOTHING about it) that I would be a few feet away from the air conditioners for the lobby and restaurants. It was so noisy, my husband and I couldn't even go out there! My bay view was a view of a dirty roof and part of the parking lot. I asked the front desk about this, and they informed me that I was in the right room. The manager rudely informed me that there was nothing that could be done, as there were few rooms left, and they had similar views.
reviews.title: Not great

description: White sand beaches and the azure waters of the Gulf of Mexico greet you at the Sheraton Sand Key Resort, set on Clearwater Beach and surrounded by gorgeous views.
